subject: College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Tyreke Evans, the most valuable player of the McDonald’s all-American game last month and one of the country’s last undecided high-profile recruits, will spend next season at Memphis. Evans announced his decision Wednesday at a news conference surrounded by his family at American Christian School in Aston, Pa., a Philadelphia suburb. A three-time state player of the year, Evans averaged 29 points a game as a senior and capped it off with a 21-point, 10-rebound performance in the McDonald’s game, the top event for high school seniors.
